A mentor to women in the field of medicine and longtime cardiology specialist is awarded for her service in guiding young female doctors to successful careers in the industry PERIOD

Dr PERIOD Laura Wexler a University of Cincinnati College of Medicine professor was recognized with the  Women in Cardiology Mentoring Award from the American Heart Associations AHA Council on Clinical Cardiology PERIOD

The award was presented to Wexler at the annual Clinical Cardiology Council Dinner at the AHAs Scientific Sessions  in Orlando Saturday Nov PERIOD  PERIOD

Im truly honored to have been nominated for this award and recognized by your peers Wexler said PERIOD

Wexler was nominated by two former residents under her tutelage at Boston University Hospital Dr PERIOD Emelia Benjamin a professor of both epidemiology and medicine at Boston University and Dr PERIOD Elyse Foster director of both the adult echocardiography laboratory and adult congenital heart disease service at the University of

California San Francisco PERIOD

The award was an initiative of the Women in Cardiology Committee and the award is given annually to individuals who have effectively mentored female cardiologists and to emphasize the importance of mentoring in the professional development

of women PERIOD

Mentorship is so important and something that needs to be sought out by all physicians Wexler said PERIOD

Wexler is a graduate of the Washington University School of Medicine in St PERIOD Louis PERIOD At Boston City Hospital she completed an internal medicine internship and residency PERIOD At the Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston Wexler completed a clinical and research fellowship in cardiology PERIOD

She joined the faculty of Boston University School of Medicine and was an investigator in the Cardiac Muscle Research Laboratory with Dr PERIOD Carl Apstein  a former recipient of this award who was nominated by Wexler in   until she moved to the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine and served as section chief of cardiology at the Cincinnati Department of Veterans Affairs VA Medical Center PERIOD

Wexler served as interim chair of the division of cardiology PERIOD Subsequently she was appointed senior associate dean of student affairs and admissions PERIOD Wexler recently retired from her dean position after  years in the position PERIOD

Wexler now devotes her time to teaching students residents and fellows at the Cincinnati VA Medical Center where she serves as associate program chair for the internal medicine

residency program PERIOD
